comments.body: The sbt version doesn't really matter, since sbt will load the one defined in project/build.properties.

Yes, that's true. What do you think about removing the mention of `project/build.properties` from the [sbt chapter](http://www.scala-native.org/en/latest/user/sbt.html)? If we specify it in the setup chapter, it would be redundant.

The `project/build.properties` file ensures that the build is reproducible across different system so it should always be created. http://www.scala-sbt.org/0.13/docs/Basic-Def.html#Specifying+the+sbt+version

+Troubleshooting
+---------------
+When compiling your Scala Native project, the linker ``ld`` may fail with the following message:
+
+::
+
+  relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
+
+It is likely that the ``LDFLAGS`` environment variable enables hardening. For example, this occurs when the ``hardening-wrapper`` package is installed on Arch Linux. It can be safely removed.
+

comments.body: We don't need libunwind deps any more either.
Please drop it here as well.

Done.  Built on my local machine & viewed in Firefox.

I also searched  all the .rst file in the docs tree for the case-insensitive string "unw".
That showed a few references, but nothing that I could see related to the full 
libunwind.

As long as I was in setup.html making non re2s related changes, it seemed fair game
for me to change the description of the default garbage collector to 'immix'. I also
provided a hyperlink to the original paper and did some rewording.

All builds & views. Hyperlink from setup.rst to intended section of sbt.rst works.

comments.body:
You can split this in two lines and then say something like:
```
$ sudo dnf install gc-devel   # optional, only if you use boehm gc
$ sudo dnf install zlib-devel # optional, only if you use java.util.zip.*
```
IMO this makes it more clear what are these dependencies for. 

It would be good to update the comment in this style everywhere for optional deps in setup instructions.
Lets change this later in another PR, it's not related to re2s.

comments.body:
I believe that the clang installation instructions on approximately line #63 needs to
change from simple `clang` to `clang-9`, possibly with a comment to 
consider using update-alternatives to make it the default clang.

With one small comment above, this PR LGTM!  
Thank you for making things current and easier to work with.

I do not want to hold up this PR. Let me float an approach to setup.rst which
I have seen work well in other projects. I wish I could remember which ones.
If devos like the approach, I can submit a follow-on PR, so this one does
not get held up by bike-shedding.

The idea is to deal with base requirements, supported variants, variants
which may work, and those known not to work using the concepts from
statistics of central tendency and variation.  That is, describe the
requirements at a high level (i.e. LLVM not llvm-9), then give
a section which says something like "Scala Native is developed on a 
number of hardware and software configurations. Continuous Integration (CI)
testing is done on the following "known good" configuration:
```
Hardware: 
Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS
Software:  openjdk-8
                  sbt-org sbt
                  clang-9,  non-LTO, LTO
                   ld.bfd
                  immix GC, boehm GC
                   foo # to test optional component
```
<insert text saying that mac-os (versions???) is not tested but is used by several developers here.>

The Java-8 discussion is a bit tricky.  Saying that scalanative-plugin only supports/works_with  Java-8
  seems to be erecting a strong barrier but, I believe, true.  Is there some softer but also true language
that could be used here?

Thanks for the comments @LeeTibbert.

> I believe that the clang installation instructions on approximately line #63 needs to
> change from simple `clang` to `clang-9`, possibly with a comment to
> consider using update-alternatives to make it the default clang.

I intentionally left this out, because the way clang discovery is done at the moment, it does not matter which clang is set the default via alternatives. The build will just pick the latest one.

I agree that the rest of the comments could go in a separate PR.

comments.body:
I am aware that this line comes from the venerable 0.4.0-M2 description but I think it
is problematic.  To make any progress at all, we can not get mired in fixing every
point 10 places to the right of the decimal. However, some are worth a bit of effort
to fix as we find them.  The interest of new devos is a precious and perishable thing.
(as he preaches to the quire.)

I think this should something like (rough) 
``` 
Java 8 or newer for projects using Scala Native
Java 8 only to build Scala Native project itself.
```
One would think the second line belongs in the Contributor's Guide. Indeed it might
be duplicated there. But by the time a new devo gets to the Contributor's Guide
the damage has been done.

Times change so I might be behind the curve. These days I use
.bash file to set a Java 8 environment to build SN itself.  Even then
I continue to hose myself on interactive builds by forgetting to
run the project login script and trying to build with the default
Java 11 on my system.
